sen.j: 足利 義栄（あしかが よしひで）は室町幕府の第14代征夷大将軍（在職：永禄11年（1568年））。
sen.e: Yoshihide ASHIKAGA was the fourteenth Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) in the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) (reign: in 1568)
Yoshihide ASHIKAGA was the fourteenth Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) (reign in 1568).
sen.cmt: changed "seii taishogun" to match the word list; eliminated colon after (reign)
sen.e: Yoshihide ASHIKAGA was the fourteenth Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) (reign in 1568).

sen.j: 天文7年（1538年）、左馬頭である足利義維（堺公方）の長男として阿波国平島荘で生まれる（生年には天文9年（1540年）説もある）。
sen.e: In 1538 he was born as the first son of Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA (Sakaikubo (head of Sakai-based municipal government)) who was Sama no kami (Captain of Samaryo, Left Division of Bureau of Horses) at Hirajima-sho manor, Awa Province (in another theory, he was born in 1540).

Yoshihide was born in 1538 as the first son of Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA (Sakaikubo (head of the Sakai-based municipal government)) who was Sama no kami (Captain of Samaryo, Left Division Bureau of Horses) at the Hirajima-sho manor in Awa Province (in another theory, Yoshihide was born in 1540).
sen.cmt: moved year; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Yoshihide was born in 1538 as the first son of Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA (Sakaikubo (head of the Sakai-based municipal government)) who was Sama no kami (Captain of Samaryo, Left Division Bureau of Horses) at the Hirajima-sho manor in Awa Province (in another theory, Yoshihide was born in 1540).

sen.j: 初名は義親（または義勝）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Yoshichika (or Yoshikatsu).
His childhood name was Yoshichika (also Yoshikatsu).
His childhood name was Yoshichika (also Yoshikatsu).

sen.j: 永禄8年（1565年）、永禄の変で第13代将軍・足利義輝が三好三人衆・松永久秀に殺害されると、三好三人衆や松永久秀らによって第14代将軍候補として擁立された。
sen.e: After the thirteenth Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA was killed by Hisahide MATSUNAGA, one of miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan), in Eiroku Incident in 1565, he was backed up as a candidate for the fourteenth Shogun by miyoshi sannninshu, Hisahide MATSUNAGA, and so on.

After the thirteenth Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA was killed by Hisahide MATSUNAGA, one of the Miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan), in the Eiroku Incident in 1565, Yoshihide was supported as a candidate to be the fourteenth Shogun by the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA, among others.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Miyoshi" in both cases; changed "he" to "Yoshihide" for clarity; changed "backed up" to "supported"; sannninshu→sanninshu; changed "and so on" to "among others"; fixed grammar
sen.e: After the thirteenth Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA was killed by Hisahide MATSUNAGA, one of the Miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan), in the Eiroku Incident in 1565, Yoshihide was supported as a candidate to be the fourteenth Shogun by the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA, among others.

sen.j: しかし同年11月から三好三人衆と松永久秀が権力抗争を開始すると、義親は12月に三好三人衆に強要されて久秀討伐令を出すことを余儀なくされた。
sen.e: However, when miyoshisanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA began power struggle since December in the same year, Yoshichka was forced to order to kill Hisahide by miyoshisanninshu.
However, when the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA began having a power struggle during December of the same year, the Miyoshi sanninshu forced Yoshichika to order the death of Hisahide.
sen.cmt: Yoshichka→Yoshichika; changed "miyoshisanninshu" to "Miyoshi sanninshu"; rearranged sentence to read more naturally; fixed grammar
sen.e: However, when the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA began having a power struggle during December of the same year, the Miyoshi sanninshu forced Yoshichika to order the death of Hisahide in the following month.
sen.cmt: 「12月に」(旧暦)→訳漏れのため訳出対応しました。

sen.j: 永禄9年（1566年）6月、三好党の篠原長房、三好康長らに擁されて淡路国に渡海する。
sen.e: On June 1566, he crossed to the Awaji Province backed up with Nagafusa SHINOHARA and Yasunaga MIYOSHI who were Miyoshi clique.
In June of 1566, Yoshihide sailed to the Awaji Province supported by Nagafusa SHINOHARA and Yasunaga MIYOSHI who were part of the Miyoshi political party.
sen.cmt: 渡海する→changed "crossed" to "sailed"; changed "backed up" to "supported"; changed "clique" to "political party"
sen.e: In June of 1566, Yoshihide sailed to the Awaji Province supported by Nagafusa SHINOHARA and Yasunaga MIYOSHI who were part of the Miyoshi political party.

sen.j: 9月23日には摂津国越水城に入城する。
sen.e: On November 14, he entered the Koshimizu-jo Castle in the Settu Province.
On November 14, he entered the Koshimizu-jo Castle in Settu Province.
On November 14, he entered the Koshimizu-jo Castle in Settu Province.

sen.j: そして冬には摂津富田 (高槻市)（現在の大阪府高槻市）の普門寺 (高槻市)に入った。
sen.e: And in winter he entered the Fumon-ji Temple in Settsu-Tonda (present Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture).
During the winter he entered the Fumon-ji Temple in Settsu-Tonde (present day Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture).
During the winter he entered the Fumon-ji Temple in Settsu-Tonda (present day Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: さらに12月28日には従五位下左馬頭に叙任されて同時に名を義親から義栄と改名した。
sen.e: In addition, on February 17, 1567, he was conferred to Sama no kami in Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and changed his name from Yoshichika to Yoshihide at the same time.
Then on February 17, 1567, when Yoshihide was ordained as Sama no kami with a rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) he changed his name from Yoshichika to Yoshihide.
Then on February 17, 1567, when Yoshihide was ordained as Sama no kami with a rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) he changed his name from Yoshichika to Yoshihide.

sen.j: 永禄10年（1567年）11月、朝廷に対して将軍就任を申請したが、朝廷の要求した献金に応じられなかったために拒絶された。
sen.e: On December 1567, he applied to be assigned to the Shogun to the Imperial Court, but was rejected because he could not contribute as requested by the Imperial Court.
On December 1567, Yoshihide applied to be assigned as Shogun to the Imperial Court, but was rejected because he was unable to contribute the amount of money requested by the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 朝廷の要求した献金に応じられなかった→"was unable to contribute the amount of money requested by the Imperial Court; changed "he" to "Yoshihde" since this is a new paragraph; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: On December 1567, Yoshihide applied to be assigned as Shogun to the Imperial Court, but was rejected because he was unable to contribute the amount of money requested by the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）2月8日、三好三人衆の推挙により、朝廷から第14代将軍として将軍宣下が下され、将軍に就任した。
sen.e: On March 16, 1568, he was appointed to the fourteenth Shogun by the Imperial Court by a recommendation of miyoshisanninshu.
On March 16, 1568, he was appointed as the fourteenth Shogun by the Imperial Court through a recommendation by the Miyoshi sanninshu.
sen.cmt: changed "of" to "as"; changed "by" to "through"; changed "miyoshisanninshu" to "Miyoshi sanninshu"
sen.e: On March 16, 1568, he was appointed as the fourteenth Shogun by the Imperial Court through a recommendation by the Miyoshi sanninshu.

tit.cmt: "The end" is unnatural here, so I changed it to read more realistically

sen.j: しかし義栄は将軍に就任しても、入京することは無かった。
sen.e: However, Yoshihide did not enter Kyoto even after he was assigned to Shogun.
Even though he was assigned to Shogun, Yoshihide never entered Kyoto.
sen.cmt: changed "However" to "Even though"; changed "did not enter" to "never entered"
sen.e: Even though he was assigned to Shogun, Yoshihide never entered Kyoto.

sen.j: 三好三人衆と松永久秀が抗争していたためと、義栄自身が背中に腫物を患っていたためである。
sen.e: This was because miyoshisanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA had a conflict and because Yoshihide himself suffered from skin boil on his back.
This was due to both the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA having a conflict and because Yoshihide was suffering from skin boils on his back.
sen.cmt: changed "miyoshisanninshu" to "Miyoshi sanninshu"; added "both"; fixed grammar
sen.e: This was due to both the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA having a conflict and because Yoshihide was suffering from skin boils on his back.

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）9月、足利義昭（義輝の次弟）を織田信長が擁立して上洛してきたため、阿波に逃れた。
sen.e: On October 1568, since Nobunaga ODA went up to Kyoto with backing up Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA (next brother of Yoshiteru), he escaped to the Awa Province.
On October 1568, Yoshihide escaped to Awa Province when Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA (younger brother of Yoshiteru) came up to Kyoto with the support of Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: changed "next" to "younger" for clarity; rearragned sentence to read more smoothly
sen.e: On October 1568, Yoshihide escaped to Awa Province when Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA (younger brother of Yoshiteru) came up to Kyoto with the support of Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: その直後、以前から患っていた腫物が悪化して病死した。
sen.e: Soon after that, he died because the skin boil got worse.
Soon after, Yoshihide's skin boils became worse than before and he passed away.
Soon after, Yoshihide's skin boils became worse than before and he passed away.

sen.j: 享年29。
sen.e: He was twenty-nine years old.
He was twenty-nine years old (or according the theory stating he was born in 1538, he was thirty-one).
sen.cmt: combined with the sentence below to reduce fragmentation and added explanation
sen.e: He was twenty-nine years old.
sen.cmt: 原文二文に対し一文で訳されていますが、仕様書に基づき二文に分割しました。

sen.j: または享年31。
sen.e: Or he was thirty-one years old.
Or he was thirty-one years old.
Or according to the theory stating he was born in 1538, he was thirty-one.

sen.j: 没した月日は9月13日 (旧暦)、9月30日 (旧暦)、10月1日 (旧暦)、10月8日 (旧暦)、10月20日 (旧暦)など諸説ある。
sen.e: There are various theories on the date of his death such as October 1, October 30, October 31, November 7, and November 19.
There are various theories on the date of his death, such as October 1, October 30, October 31, November 7, and November 19.
There are various theories on the date of his death, such as October 1, October 30, October 31, November 7, and November 19.

sen.j: また死去した場所も阿波のほかに淡路、摂津の普門寺など諸説ある。
sen.e: In addition, there are various theories on the place of his death such as the Awaji Province and the Fumon-ji Temple in the Settsu Province as well as the Awa Province.
There are also a number of theories on the location of his death, such as Awaji Province, the Fumon-ji Temple in Settsu Province or Awa Province.
sen.cmt: changed "In addition" to "also" placed later in the sentence; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: There are also a number of theories on the location of his death, such as Awa Province, Awaji Province, or the Fumon-ji Temple in Settsu Province.
sen.cmt: Awa Provinceの順序を入れ替えました。

tit.cmt: 統一リストに従って修正

sen.j: 室町幕府歴代将軍の中で、唯一本拠地のある京都に1度も足を踏み入れずに終わっている。
sen.e: He was a only person among successive Shogun in the Muromachi bakufu who did not enter Kyoto which was the base of bakufu.
Yoshihide was the only one among successive Shogun within the Muromachi bakufu whose reign ended without ever setting foot in Kyoto as the base of the bakufu.
sen.cmt: changed "He" to "Yoshihide" since this is a new section and paragraph; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Yoshihide was the only one among successive Shogun within the Muromachi bakufu whose reign ended without ever setting foot in Kyoto as the base of the bakufu.

sen.j: 日本史上本拠地に入ること無く終わった将軍は彼と徳川慶喜（大坂城で将軍に就任し、大政奉還で職を解かれた後に江戸城に入った）のみである。
sen.e: The Shogun who could not enter the base of bakufu in Japanese history were only he and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA (assigned to Shogun at the Osaka-jo Castle and entered the Edo-jo Castle after he left Shogun by Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor)).

The only Shoguns in Japanese history to see the end of their rule without ever entering the base of the bakufu were Yoshihide and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA (Yoshinobu had been assigned to Shogun at Osaka-jo Castle and went to Edo-jo Castle after leaving the post of Shogun due to Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor)).

The only Shoguns in Japanese history to see the end of their rule without ever entering the base of the bakufu were Yoshihide and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA (Yoshinobu had been assigned to Shogun at Osaka-jo Castle and went to Edo-jo Castle after leaving the post of Shogun due to Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor)).

sen.j: 主体性が無く、三好三人衆と松永久秀による完全な傀儡将軍であった。
sen.e: He did not show his opinion clearly and was a complete puppet Shogun controlled by miyoshisanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA.
Yoshihide never expressed clear opinions and was a complete puppet Shogun controlled by the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA.
sen.cmt: changed "He" to "Yoshihide" since this is a new paragraph; changed "show" to "expressed"; changed "miyoshisanninshu" to "Miyoshi sanninshu"
sen.e: Yoshihide never expressed clear opinions and was a complete puppet Shogun controlled by the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA.

sen.j: 三好三人衆と松永久秀が抗争した一因には、この義栄を誰が擁立するかという理由もあったとされている。
sen.e: It is said that one of the reason for the conflict between miyoshisanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA was who backed up this Yoshihide.
One of the reasons for the conflict between the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA is said to be due to the unanswered question as to who really supported Yoshihide.
One of the reasons for the conflict between the Miyoshi sanninshu and Hisahide MATSUNAGA is said to be due to the unanswered question as to who really supported Yoshihide.

sen.j: 官職位階履歴
sen.e: Official Court Ranks
Official Court Ranks
Record of Offices and Ranks Held
sen.cmt: 統一リストに基づき修正

sen.j: ※日付＝旧暦
sen.e: *Date was based on the old calendar.
*Date are based on the old Japanese calendar.
Date according to old lunar calendar
sen.cmt: 統一リストに基づき修正

sen.j: 永禄9年（1566年）12月28日、従五位下に叙す。
sen.e: On February 17, 1566, he was conferred to Jugoinoge.
Conferred to Jugoinoge on February 17, 1566.
Conferred to Jugoinoge on December 28, 1566.
sen.cmt: 上に「日付＝旧暦」という記載があるため、旧暦表記に修正

sen.j: 永禄10年（1567年）1月5日、左馬頭に任官
sen.e: On February 23, 1567, he was assigned to Sama no kami.
Assigned to Sama no kami on February 23, 1567.
Assigned to Sama no kami on January 5, 1567.

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）2月8日、征夷大将軍宣下。
sen.e: On March 16, 1568, he was appointed to Seitaishogun.
Appointed to Seii Taishogun on March 16, 1568.
sen.cmt: split "Seitaishogun" into two words to match the word list; rearranged to read more smoothly
sen.e: Appointed to Seii Taishogun on February 8, 1568.

sen.j: 禁色賜り、昇殿を許される。
sen.e: He was given kinjiki (literally, "forbidden colors," seven colors traditionally reserved for the imperial family and nobility) and allowed the entry into the palace.
Given the right to wear kinjiki (literally, "forbidden colors," seven colors traditionally reserved for the imperial family and nobility) and allowed entry into the palace.
Given the right to wear kinjiki (literally, "forbidden colors," seven colors traditionally reserved for the imperial family and nobility) and allowed entry into the palace.
